result.execSummary:
The defendant Faith L. Peters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

timeConds.notes: Community Service to be coordinated with supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Faith L. Peters

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 10:34 AM Defendant Faith L. Peters in court.  Attorney Dennis Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein in court for Faith L. Peters. Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Upon motion of the State, the Court amends Count 1 to Disorderly Conduct contrary to Wis. Stat. 947.01(1). Plea: NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Statement by Atty Blankschein. No statement by DE. Court orders: S/W - 12 months probation. Conditions: AODA and follow through. The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. 10 hours of community service to be coordinated with supervising agent. Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Faith L. Peters appeared by phone.  Attorney Emma K. Blankschein appeared by phone for Failth L. Peters. Attorney Matthew Leusink appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Atty Blankschein believes that they are close to resolution and is requesting a P/S hearing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 3, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Status conference on April 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

Case called @ 2:13 PM Defendant Faith L. Peters in court.  Attorney Matthew Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein in court for Faith L. Peters.Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  NGP entered. The Court recognizes the request for substitution. Bond argument by DA Leusink. No objection by Atty Blankschein. Court orders $2000 Sig Bond.    STC to be scheduled with the newly assigned Court.
